Zopiclone and zolpidem have the same potential adverse effects as benzodiazepines, particularly in the elderly.

Like benzodiazepines, they can both lead to "pharmacological tolerance", "use disorders" and "rebound anxiety" when stopped.

For other treatments, please refer to the relevant sections.

question.title: What is a common adverse effect of zopiclone and zolpidem, particularly in elderly patients?
question.description: Zopiclone and zolpidem have the same potential adverse effects as benzodiazepines, particularly in the elderly. What is a common adverse effect of these medications?

option_a.title: Rebound depression
option_a.description: A type of depression that occurs when a medication is stopped after long-term use

option_b.title: Pharmacological tolerance
option_b.description: The need for increased doses of a medication to achieve the same effect

option_c.title: Use disorders
option_c.description: Abuse or dependence on a medication

option_d.title: Rebound anxiety
option_d.description: Anxiety that occurs when a benzodiazepine is stopped after long-term use

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The letter of the correct option
